articles.headline: Energy Prices Are Bright Sliver in Grim Economy
articles.snippet: Oil has dropped more than $23 a barrel, or 16 percent, and gasoline prices have fallen as Americans drive less.
articles.abstract: Oil has dropped more than $23 a barrel, or 16 percent, and gasoline prices have fallen as Americans drive less.
articles.lead_paragraph: The sharp drop in energy prices since the beginning of the month is turning into a rare bright spot in a bleak economic landscape.

articles.headline: Top 2 Bosses at Alcatel Are Leaving
articles.snippet: A trans-Atlantic culture clash at Alcatel-Lucent, the French-American telecommunications equipment maker, hit home Tuesday when the company’s top two executives said they would step down.
articles.abstract: A trans-Atlantic culture clash at Alcatel-Lucent, the French-American telecommunications equipment maker, hit home Tuesday when the company’s top two executives said they would step down.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS  A trans-Atlantic culture clash at Alcatel-Lucent, the French-American telecommunications equipment maker created in a $10.7 billion merger two years ago, hit home Tuesday when the company’s top two executives said they would step down.

articles.headline: U.S. Won’t Release Land in Conservation Program
articles.snippet: Despite pressure, the Department of Agriculture said it would not waive penalties for farmers who decide to plant crops on land set aside for conservation.
articles.abstract: Despite pressure, the Department of Agriculture said it would not waive penalties for farmers who decide to plant crops on land set aside for conservation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Amid improving harvest expectations for this year, the United States agriculture secretary, Ed Schafer, said Tuesday that he would not lift penalties for farmers who plant crops on land set aside for conservation.

articles.headline: C.I.A. Outlines Pakistan Links With Militants
articles.snippet: The agency presented Pakistan with evidence showing that members of its spy service had deepened ties with militant groups in Pakistan’s tribal areas.
articles.abstract: The agency presented Pakistan with evidence showing that members of its spy service had deepened ties with militant groups in Pakistan’s tribal areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  A top Central Intelligence Agency official traveled secretly to Islamabad this month to confront Pakistan’s most senior officials with new information about ties between the country’s powerful spy service and militants operating in Pakistan’s tribal areas, according to American military and intelligence officials.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: A Deal at Merrill Puts Spotlight on Others
articles.snippet: The fire sale of mortgage investments at Merrill Lynch raises a troubling question for the nation’s financial industry: Have other banks with similar investments overestimated their values?
articles.abstract: The fire sale of mortgage investments at Merrill Lynch raises a troubling question for the nation’s financial industry: Have other banks with similar investments overestimated their values?
articles.lead_paragraph: Somehow, $4.4 billion just evaporated at Merrill Lynch.

articles.headline: Only a Game? A Fight Over Scrabble Has Web Fans Fuming
articles.snippet: The Calcutta-based brothers who developed Scrabulous bowed to legal pressure and barred North American users from playing the game on Facebook.
articles.abstract: The Calcutta-based brothers who developed Scrabulous bowed to legal pressure and barred North American users from playing the game on Facebook.

articles.headline: Teaching Law, Testing Ideas, Obama Stood Slightly Apart
articles.snippet: In his 12 years teaching at the University of Chicago Law School, Barack Obama was both popular and enigmatic.
articles.abstract: In his 12 years teaching at the University of Chicago Law School, Barack Obama was both popular and enigmatic.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The young law professor stood apart in too many ways to count. At a school where economic analysis was all the rage, he taught rights, race and gender. Other faculty members dreamed of tenured positions; he turned them down. While most colleagues published by the pound, he never completed a single work of legal scholarship.

articles.headline: An Investment Firm That Prospered From Past Crises Turns to Mortgages
articles.snippet: John P. Grayken made a fortune buying investments no one else seemed to want during the savings and loan debacle in the early 1990s. Now he is trying to repeat that feat by buying mortgages.
articles.abstract: John P. Grayken made a fortune buying investments no one else seemed to want during the savings and loan debacle in the early 1990s. Now he is trying to repeat that feat by buying mortgages.
articles.lead_paragraph: John P. Grayken made a fortune buying investments no one else seemed to want during the savings and loan debacle in the early 1990s. Now he is trying to repeat that feat by buying the detritus of today’s mortgage crisis.

articles.headline: After 7 Years, Talks Collapse on World Trade
articles.snippet: After years of on-again, off-again negotiations, world trade talks collapsed in rancor, ending hopes of a deal to open markets and cut farm subsidies.
articles.abstract: After years of on-again, off-again negotiations, world trade talks collapsed in rancor, ending hopes of a deal to open markets and cut farm subsidies.
articles.lead_paragraph: GENEVA  World trade talks collapsed here on Tuesday after seven years of on-again, off-again negotiations, in the latest sign of India’s and China’s growing might on the world stage and the decreasing ability of the United States to impose its will globally.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Restaurant Chains Close as Diners Reduce Spending
articles.snippet: Soaring food costs and a surfeit of locations have hurt the casual dining sector’s bottom lines just as Americans are choosing to take more meals at home.
articles.abstract: Soaring food costs and a surfeit of locations have hurt the casual dining sector’s bottom lines just as Americans are choosing to take more meals at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: Several national restaurant chains were shuttered on Tuesday, possibly offering an early taste of what’s in store this year for businesses that depend on free-spending consumers whose budgets are now being squeezed.

articles.headline: With Security at Risk, a Push to Patch the Web
articles.snippet: Internet service providers are racing to fix a problem that makes it possible for criminals to divert users to fake sites.
articles.abstract: Internet service providers are racing to fix a problem that makes it possible for criminals to divert users to fake sites.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since a secret emergency meeting of computer security experts at Microsoft’s headquarters in March, Dan Kaminsky has been urging companies around the world to fix a potentially dangerous flaw in the basic plumbing of the Internet.
